abstract: Rare portrait by painter Joan Carlile becomes earliest work by female artist to enter Tate collection, which has committed to featuring more female artists.
lead_paragraph: “Portrait of an Unknown Lady” was made between 1650 and 1655 by Joan Carlile, one of the first women known to be a professional painter in England.
snippet: “Portrait of an Unknown Lady” was made between 1650 and 1655 by Joan Carlile, one of the first women known to be a professional painter in England....

headline.main: A 17th-Century Portrait Will Be the Earliest Painting by a Woman at the Tate
headline.print_headline: Tate Gets Rare Work by Female Painter
